channel.title: [IDEA] Lord of the Rings RSPS
channel.description:
Hey Mopar,
I think about making an RSPS based on the Lord of the Rings.
I got some ideas like custom training places, like Ranged training place will be Helm's Deep, you can get magic exp from Gandalf and that kind of stuff.
I'm also thinking of choosing a race when you register your account. Will be hard though.
Do you think this is a good idea? Please leave your opinion. Ideas are welcome too.
Thanks!
~ Mthijs3

item.title: [IDEA] Lord of the Rings RSPS
item.dc:creator: @Host_Gushers Host Gushers
item.description:
@Host_Gushers wrote:

Gl bro, would be the best rsps eva tho

Read full topic

item.title: [IDEA] Lord of the Rings RSPS
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

Why not just make a new game with your own code rather than recycle the shitty code of rsps? We’ve all seen how much people hate the current state of PI.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

It never succeeded.
By that I mean no one ever heard about it.

item.title: [IDEA] Lord of the Rings RSPS
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:5, topic:502731”][quote author=Christmas_tree link=topic=620959.msg4253172#msg4253172 date=1362437094]
I guess a quest could be pulled off. But a whole server? Some guys a while back tried to make a single person game. They did it but it sucked.
[/quote]What? I remember the first person shooter which was not a failure at all

Just never got fully finished[/quote]

Why in the F-word’in world have I not even seen or heard of this?!

Read full topic

item.title: [IDEA] Lord of the Rings RSPS
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

If it was designed properly I think it’s a pretty nice idea actually. It’d be pretty cool to see this done.

Read full topic

item.title: [IDEA] Lord of the Rings RSPS
item.dc:creator: @JavaLearner JavaLearner
item.description:
@JavaLearner wrote:

[quote=“Christmas_tree, post:4, topic:502731”]I guess a quest could be pulled off. But a whole server? Some guys a while back tried to make a single person game. They did it but it sucked.[/quote]A quest would work indeed… Where Gondor = Gielinor, Rivendell = Tarasmyr, Mordor = some vulcano in the Wilderness, Moria = Keldagrim, Rohan = Ardougne or so…

Read full topic

item.title: [IDEA] Lord of the Rings RSPS
item.dc:creator: @Potzon Potzon
item.description:
@Potzon wrote:

Christmas_tree:

I guess a quest could be pulled off. But a whole server? Some guys a while back tried to make a single person game. They did it but it sucked.

I agree With Christmas_tree, sorry, but I think it sounds better with a quest.

One more thing…

Will require *TONS* of graphical updates, fixes, and implementation.
^ He's right. (Flame_) You would probably have to make new graphics/animations yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: [IDEA] Lord of the Rings RSPS
item.dc:creator: @Christmas_tree Christmas_tree
item.description:
@Christmas_tree wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:5, topic:502731”][quote author=Christmas_tree link=topic=620959.msg4253172#msg4253172 date=1362437094]
I guess a quest could be pulled off. But a whole server? Some guys a while back tried to make a single person game. They did it but it sucked.
[/quote]What? I remember the first person shooter which was not a failure at all

Just never got fully finished[/quote]

iirc it was czar based and the original idea didn’t work because they had model issues and they found it got boring. Also, it kind of defeated the point of RSPS.

Edit: you’re talking about the fps.!'m talking about a sever that was GTA based I believe. Also: harry stopped work on that a while back

Read full topic

item.title: [IDEA] Lord of the Rings RSPS
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Will require TONS of graphical updates, fixes, and implementation.
Otherwise, it is a good idea in theory.
You need to spend some time thinking the storyline through, as you cannot base a private server off of a movie and have the game as a freestyle until the game is completed. Then, you need to have some sort of activity to keep players from getting bored once the plot is finished.

Read full topic
